a type of smoked (= preserved using smoke) sausage made from pork and beef: The charcuteries offer an infinite array of delicious hams and sausages such as cervelat, Strasbourg, or Montbéliard. The best cervelats are the ones that come from Germany. The platter includes cervelat sausage and emmental cheese with pickles and tomato, tossed in French mustard dressing.
More examplesFewer examplesServe the dish as antipasto together with kalamata olives, dry cervelat salami, and some good quality parmesan cheese. The cervelat, a cooked sausage, is often referred to as Switzerland's national sausage.
